title: Standard Method for inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
description: The schema outlines the required metadata to define a standard method or protocol for the ICP-MS analysis

e-rihs_pid.title: E-RIHS Service PID
e-rihs_pid.description: Please link to the E-RIHS Service ID

alternative_labels.title: Alternative Lables or Names
alternative_labels.description: Any alternative names or labels for the method. This could be an acronym or a full text name if an acronym is used as the

method_type.title: Method Type
method_type.description: The type of method this represents

technique.title: Relevant Technique
technique.description: The general technique that this method is an application of

method_version.title: Version
method_version.description: The version identifier for this method

creation_date.title: Creation Date
creation_date.description: The date this method was created

author.title: Author
author.description: A relevant person ID, either a local database ID or an ORCID for the creator or author of this method

method_documentation.title: Method Documentation
method_documentation.description: The document that describes the method used in the analysis

related_tools.title: Related Tools
related_tools.description: The key related tools (Equipment or Software) described associated with this method

solutionIntro.title: solution introduction system
solutionIntro.description: Solution introduction system brand and model (e.g. Teledyne Cetac Aridus II)

peltierTemp.title: peltier temperature [°C]
peltierTemp.description: Temperature in degree Celsius of peliter element for cyclonic spray chamber when in wet plasma mode

sweepGasFlow.title: sweep gas flow rate [l/min]
sweepGasFlow.description: Sweep gas flow rate for desolvating nebuliser systems (l/min)

additionalGasType.title: type of additional gas
additionalGasType.description: Type of additional carrier gas (e.g. N2, H) for desolvating nebulizer systems

additionalGasFlow.title: additional gas flow rate [l/min]
additionalGasFlow.description: Additional carrier gas flow rate for desolvating nebulizer systems

nabh4Con.title: NaBH4 concentration [%]
nabh4Con.description: NaBH4 concentration (% (w/v)) for hydride generator only

nabh4Uptake.title: Uptake rate of NaBH4 [ml/min]
nabh4Uptake.description: NaBH4 uptake rate (ml/min) for hydride generator only

hclCon.title: HCL concentration [M]
hclCon.description: HCL concentration (M) for hydride generator only

hclUptake.title: Uptake Rate of HCL [ml/min]
hclUptake.description: HCL uptake rate (ml/min) for hydride generator

hyGenGas.title: carrier gas for hydride generator
hyGenGas.description: Hydride generator carrier gas (e.g. argon, helium)

solidSampleWeight.title: solid sample weight [mg]
solidSampleWeight.description: Sample weight (mg) for the electrothermal vaporization (ETV)

solutionSampleVolume.title: volume of sample solution [μl]
solutionSampleVolume.description: Sample solution volume (μl) for the electrothermal vaporization (ETV)

chemModifier.title: chemical modifier
chemModifier.description: Chemical modifier used and weight (μg) or volume (μl) for ETV (e.g. ascorbic acid 300μg + Pd 1μg)

etvTempStep.title: ETV temperature programe step
etvTempStep.description: ETV temperature programe steps. For instance, 1 - Dry : 110°C, 10s (ramp), 15s (hold). 2- Pyolisis 1100°C, 10s (ramp), 45s (hold), 3 - Vaporisation 2600°C, 0.5s (ramp), 1s (hold)

etvGasFlow.title: ETV carrier gas flow [l/min]
etvGasFlow.description: ETV carrier gas flow (I/min) transporting analyte from furnace to ICP torch (e.g. 0.7 I/min)

acqDuration.title: duration of singal acquisition [s]
acqDuration.description: Duration of singal acquisition on solution in seconds

washTime.title: washing time [s]
washTime.description: Duration of washing time between solutions in seconds

analySeq.title: analytical sequence
analySeq.description: Description of the analytical sequence/run. For instance, sequence is composed of 2 procedurial blanks, 11 unknown, 2 BCR-2, backeted by 2 duplicates of BHVO-2 ran as calibration solution

calStrategy.title: calibration strategy
calStrategy.description: Strategy used for calibration on the instrument and quantification (e.g. external calibration; single internal standard addition; multiple internal standard addition; enriched isotopes addition...etc)

calReferenceMaterial.title: calibrating reference material/solution
calReferenceMaterial.description: Calibrating solution used e.g. BHVO-2; custom made solution using (e.g. selenium [25 ppb]+tellurium [20 ppb] + arsenic [20 ppb])

internalStandard.title: internal standard
internalStandard.description: List of natural or enriched isotopes used/added for internal standardisation (e.g. 6Li, 84Sr, 115In, 147Sm, 209Bi, 235U)

dilutionFactor.title: dilution factor
dilutionFactor.description: Dilution factors used e.g. BHVO-2 dilution factor 6000; blanks dilution factor 1000; sample dilution factor 4000

tubingMaterialDiameter.title: diameter of tubing material [mm]
tubingMaterialDiameter.description: Diameter of tubing material in millimeter

laserMetadata.title: Laser Metadata
laserMetadata.description: Configuration of laser for the ICP-MS analysis

pulseWidthValue.title: pulse width
pulseWidthValue.description: Pulse width of laser in picosecond, femtosecond, or nanosecond

laserFluence.title: laser fluence [J/cm2]
laserFluence.description: laserFluence in joules per square centimeter

cellModel.title: cell model
cellModel.description: Brand and model of ablation cell

ablationGas.title: ablation gas
ablationGas.description: Type of main ablation/carrier gas (e.g. He, Ar)

ablationGasFlow.title: ablation gas flow rate [l/min]
ablationGasFlow.description: Flow rate of main ablation/carrier gas (I/min)

mixingDevice.title: mixing device
mixingDevice.description: Mixing/smoothing device used to homogenize/smooth the signal (e.g. Y connector, Bulb, Squid, Coil)

gasBlankDuration.title: Duration of gas blank [s]
gasBlankDuration.description: Duration of gas blank/instrument background measurement in second

ablationDuration.title: ablation duration [s]
ablationDuration.description: Duration of laser ablation in second

additionalGas.title: additional gas
additionalGas.description: Type of additional carrier gas (e.g. N2, H)

washTime.title: wash time [s]
washTime.description: Duration of washing time between solutions in second

analyticalSequence.title: analytical sequence
analyticalSequence.description: Description of the analytical sequence/run. For instance, sequence is composed of 2 procedurial blanks, 11 unknown, 2 BCR-2, backeted by 2 duplicates of BHVO-2 ran as calibration solution

calStrategy.title: calibration strategy
calStrategy.description: Strategy used for calibration on the instrument and quantification (e.g. external calibration; single internal standard addition; multiple internal standard addition; enriched isotopes addition...etc)

purposeReference1.title: purpose of calibrating reference material #1
purposeReference1.description: Purpose of calibrating reference material (e.g. U-Pb, trace elements, PGEs, specific set of TE)

purposeReference2.title: purpose of calibrating reference material #2
purposeReference2.description: Purpose of calibrating reference material (e.g. U-Pb, trace elements, PGEs, specific set of TE)

purposeReference3.title: purpose of calibrating reference material #3
purposeReference3.description: Purpose of calibrating reference material (e.g. U-Pb, trace elements, PGEs, specific set of TE)

QSampleIntro.title: sample introduction details
QSampleIntro.description: Details of sample introduction system (e.g. laser ablation; solution; ablation aersol combined with coaspiration of desolvated Tl-235U tracer using a DSN-100 desovating nebulizer

rfPower.title: RF power [W]
rfPower.description: Radio frequency power (W) applied to coil to generate plasma (typically 1000-1500 W)

rfMatching.title: RF frequency matching [V]
rfMatching.description: RF matching compensates for changes in impedance (a material's resistance to the flow of an electric current) produced by the sample's matrix components or differences in solvent volatility

sampleDepth.title: sample depth [mm]
sampleDepth.description: Distance in mm between coil and sampling cone

samplerCone.title: sampler cone details
samplerCone.description: Sampler cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. standard, jet), orifice dimension (internal diamter from 0.8 to 1.2 mm)

samplerMaterial.title: sampler material
samplerMaterial.description: Material that the sampler cone is made of

skimmerCone.title: skimmer cone details
skimmerCone.description: Skimmer cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. H, X), orfice dimension (internal diameter from 0.4 to 0.8 mm)

skimmerMaterial.title: skimmer cone material
skimmerMaterial.description: Material that skimmer cone is made of

collisionCellGas.title: collision cell gas
collisionCellGas.description: Type of gas used in the collision cell (e.g. He)

detectionSystem.title: detection system
detectionSystem.description: Type of detector used (e.g. electron multiplier; mixed Faraday-multiple ion counting array]

dwellTime.title: dwell times [ms]
dwellTime.description: Counting time on each mass (e.g. 200 ms for each isotope; 200 ms on mass X and 100 ms on mass Y

oxideMonitor.title: oxide monitor
oxideMonitor.description: Mass-ratio monitored to estimate oxide formation (e.g. 248ThO+/232Th+156CeO+/140Ce+)

oxideProduction.title: oxide production [%]
oxideProduction.description: Percentage of oxide formation (typically preferred to be below > 1%)

doublySpeciesMonitor.title: doubly-charged species monitor
doublySpeciesMonitor.description: Mass-ratio monitored to estimate doubly-charged species formation (e.g. 22Ca++/44Ca+; 70Ce++/140Ce+)

doublyChargedProduction.title: doubly-charged species production [%]
doublyChargedProduction.description: Percentage of doubly-charged species formation (typically preferred to be below > 1.5%)

QICPMSComment.title: Comments
QICPMSComment.description: Additional information about Q-ICP-MS analytical methods

MCSampleIntro.title: sample introduction details
MCSampleIntro.description: Details of sample introduction system (e.g. laser ablation; solution; ablation aersol combined with coaspiration of desolvated Tl-235U tracer using a DSN-100 desovating nebulizer

rfPower.title: RF power [W]
rfPower.description: Radio frequency power (W) applied to coil to generate plasma (typically 1000-1500 W)

samplerCone.title: sampler cone details
samplerCone.description: Sampler cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. standard, jet), orifice dimension (internal diamter from 0.8 to 1.2 mm)

samplerMaterial.title: sampler material
samplerMaterial.description: Material that the sampler cone is made of

skimmerCone.title: skimmer cone details
skimmerCone.description: Skimmer cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. H, X), orfice dimension (internal diameter from 0.4 to 0.8 mm)

skimmerMaterial.title: skimmer cone material
skimmerMaterial.description: Material that skimmer cone is made of

detectionSystem.title: detection system
detectionSystem.description: Type of detector used (e.g. electron multiplier; mixed Faraday-multiple ion counting array]

resolutionMode.title: resolution mode
resolutionMode.description: Resolution mode used (e.g. low resolution, pseudo high resolution or high resolution). Pesudo and high resolution modes are commonly used to resolve interfering isobaric peaks

magnetDelay.title: magnet delay [s]
magnetDelay.description: Time delay in seconds applied after each time a magnet switch occurs (usually 2 seconds)

massesMeasured.title: masses measured
massesMeasured.description: Masses measured (e.g. 202-207, 235, 238). If not a static mode and multiple "magnet" cycles are implemented, do precise the number of cycles and masses measured in each cycle (e.g. cycle #1: 202, 204, 206, 207, 208; cycle #2: 232, 234, 235, 238)

integrationTimes.title: integration times [s]
integrationTimes.description: Beam counting time for each measurement in seconds (e.g. 10 s)

zeroInteTime.title: zero integration time [s]
zeroInteTime.description: Background counting time for each zero measurement in seconds (e.g. 60 s)

peakCenterMass.title: peak cenetering mass
peakCenterMass.description: Mass used to position the center of the peaks (e.g. 180)

deltaM.title: delta M [amu]
deltaM.description: HR mode only. Delta M in a.m.u. When resolving isobaric interferences in high resolution mode, a precise and constant mass offset (delta M) can be applied to the main body of a peak in order to locate lower interference-free peak edges. Main peak (interfered) is identified by instrument and Delta M is added or removed from it, allowing magnet to be centered on the interference-free edge of an isotope of choice during analysis (e.g. 57Fe overlapped by 17O + 40Ar: main body of peak is 17O + 40Ar at 56.978 and 57Fe shoulder is located at 56.966 and therefore a Delta M of 0.0126 a.m.u.)

numberBlock.title: number of block
numberBlock.description: Solution mode only.Number of blocks of measurements (e.g. 2)

numberMeasureBlock.title: number of measurements per block
numberMeasureBlock.description: Number of measurement per block (e.g. 25; 2 blocks and 25 measurements per block give 50 measurements per analysis)

MCICPMSComment.title: Comments
MCICPMSComment.description: Additional information about MC-ICP-MS analytical methods

MSMSSampleIntro.title: sample introduction details
MSMSSampleIntro.description: Details of sample introduction system (e.g. laser ablation; solution; ablation aersol combined with coaspiration of desolvated Tl-235U tracer using a DSN-100 desovating nebulizer

rfPower.title: RF power [W]
rfPower.description: Radio frequency power (W) applied to coil to generate plasma (typically 1000-1500 W)

rfMatching.title: RF frequency matching [V]
rfMatching.description: RF matching compensates for changes in impedance (a material's resistance to the flow of an electric current) produced by the sample's matrix components or differences in solvent volatility

sampleDepth.title: sample depth [mm]
sampleDepth.description: Distance in mm between coil and sampling cone

samplerCone.title: sampler cone details
samplerCone.description: Sampler cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. standard, jet), orifice dimension (internal diamter from 0.8 to 1.2 mm)

samplerMaterial.title: sampler material
samplerMaterial.description: Material that the sampler cone is made of

skimmerCone.title: skimmer cone details
skimmerCone.description: Skimmer cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. H, X), orfice dimension (internal diameter from 0.4 to 0.8 mm)

skimmerMaterial.title: skimmer cone material
skimmerMaterial.description: Material that skimmer cone is made of

Q1TargetMass.title: Q1 target masses (1st mass filter)
Q1TargetMass.description: Masses scanned by the first quadrupole (Q2 filter) e.g. 46Ti, 47Ti, 48Ti, 49TI, 50Ti

MSMSMode.title: MS/MS mode
MSMSMode.description: On-Mass mode vs mass-shift mode. MS/MS strategy: On-mass mode (Q1 and Q2 are both set to the same target masses; interfering ions are either filtered by collision or by mass-shifted by reaction; or instrument is used in "single quad mode" with no gas in the cell) or Mass-shift mode (Q1 and Q2 are set to different target masses; analyte ions are mass-shifted by reaction and Q2 is set to the masses of reaction products)

collisionCellGas.title: collision/reaction cell gas
collisionCellGas.description: Type of gas used in the MS/MS collision/reaction cell (e.g. NH3, N2O, CH4, No Gas)

collisionGasPurity.title: collision/reaction cell gas purity
collisionGasPurity.description: Purity of the gas used in the MS/MS collision reaction cell (e.g. high purity; ultra high purity)

CollisionGasFlow.title: collision/reaction cell gas flow [ml/min]
CollisionGasFlow.description: Collision/reaction cell gas flow (ml per min); can also be expressed in sccm (standard cubic centimeter per minute), 1 sccm = 1 ml/min

waitTimeOffset.title: wait time offset [ms]
waitTimeOffset.description: The wait time offset is a delay in ms (e.g. 2 ms) implemented to slightly dephased the scanning of Q2 relative to Q1 in order to compensate for the slowdown of the ions in the cell due to the collision/reaction process

detectionSystem.title: detection system
detectionSystem.description: Type of detector used (e.g. electron multiplier; mixed Faraday-multiple ion counting array]

massesAfterQ2.title: masses measured after Q2
massesAfterQ2.description: Masses measured after the second quadrupole (Q2) e.g. 62 (46Ti16O), 63 (47Ti16O), 64 (48Ti16O), 65 (49Ti16O), 66 (50Ti16O) (if O mass-shifted)

dwellTime.title: dwell times [ms]
dwellTime.description: Counting time on each mass (e.g. 200 ms for each isotope; 200 ms on mass X and 100 ms on mass Y

oxideMonitor.title: oxide monitor
oxideMonitor.description: Mass-ratio monitored to estimate oxide formation (e.g. 248ThO+/232Th+156CeO+/140Ce+)

oxideProduction.title: oxide production [%]
oxideProduction.description: Percentage of oxide formation (typically preferred to be below > 1%)

doublySpeciesMonitor.title: doubly-charged species monitor
doublySpeciesMonitor.description: Mass-ratio monitored to estimate doubly-charged species formation (e.g. 22Ca++/44Ca+; 70Ce++/140Ce+)

doublyChargedProduction.title: doubly-charged species production [%]
doublyChargedProduction.description: Percentage of doubly-charged species formation (typically preferred to be below > 1.5%)

ICPMSMSComment.title: Comments
ICPMSMSComment.description: Additional information about ICP-MS-MS analytical methods

MSMSSampleIntro.title: sample introduction details
MSMSSampleIntro.description: Details of sample introduction system (e.g. laser ablation; solution; ablation aersol combined with coaspiration of desolvated Tl-235U tracer using a DSN-100 desovating nebulizer

rfPower.title: RF power [W]
rfPower.description: Radio frequency power (W) applied to coil to generate plasma (typically 1000-1500 W)

samplerCone.title: sampler cone details
samplerCone.description: Sampler cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. standard, jet), orifice dimension (internal diamter from 0.8 to 1.2 mm)

samplerMaterial.title: sampler material
samplerMaterial.description: Material that the sampler cone is made of

skimmerCone.title: skimmer cone details
skimmerCone.description: Skimmer cone details, such as material (e.g. nickel, platinum, aluminium), geometry (e.g. H, X), orfice dimension (internal diameter from 0.4 to 0.8 mm)

skimmerMaterial.title: skimmer cone material
skimmerMaterial.description: Material that skimmer cone is made of

detectionSystem.title: detection system
detectionSystem.description: Type of detector used (e.g. electron multiplier; mixed Faraday-multiple ion counting array]

resolutionMode.title: resolution mode
resolutionMode.description: Resolution mode used (e.g. low resolution, pseudo high resolution or high resolution; 300, 2000, 3000, 5000). Pesudo and high resolution modes are commonly used to resolve interfering isobaric peaks

magnetDelay.title: magnet delay [s]
magnetDelay.description: Time delay in seconds applied after each time a magnet switch occurs (usually 2 seconds)

fastScan.title: fast scan mode
fastScan.description: In FastScan mode the magnet is set to a static position and ion optics deflect the beam over a limited mass range in an extremely fast and reliable manner

scanWindow.title: scan window [%]
scanWindow.description: Width of the scanned and integrated window of a peak (e.g. 0 = peak top; 100% full peak width)

dwellTime.title: dwell times [ms]
dwellTime.description: Counting time on each mass (e.g. 200 ms for each isotope; 200 ms on mass X and 100 ms on mass Y

zeroInteTime.title: zero integration time [s]
zeroInteTime.description: Background counting time for each zero measurement in seconds (e.g. 60 s)

peakCenterMass.title: peak cenetering mass
peakCenterMass.description: Mass used to position the center of the peaks (e.g. 180)

numberSweep.title: number of sweep
numberSweep.description: number of sweeps (e.g. 200). A sweep consists of 1 ramp up and 1 ramp down of the defined mass range, therefore 2 data sets

numberCycles.title: number of cycles
numberCycles.description: Number of sweep cycles (e.g. 10). 10 cycles of 200 sweeps equals to 4000 data sets

HRICPMSComment.title: Comments
HRICPMSComment.description: Additional information about HR-ICP-MS analytical methods
